definition: a fastener that serves to join or connect, form a knot or bow in
details:
noun
- a fastener that serves to join or connect
= synonyms: link
- neckwear consisting of a long narrow piece of material worn under a collar and tied in knot at the front
= example: neckwear consisting of a long narrow piece of material worn under a collar and tied in knot at the front
= synonyms: necktie
- a cord, string, ribbon, wire etc. with which something is tied
= example: a cord, string, ribbon, wire etc. with which something is tied
- a horizontal beam used to prevent two other structural members from spreading apart or separating
= example: a horizontal beam used to prevent two other structural members from spreading apart or separating
= synonyms: tie beam
- one of the cross braces that support the rails on a railway track
= example: one of the cross braces that support the rails on a railway track
= synonyms: sleeper
- (music) a slur over two notes of the same pitch
- the finish of a contest in which the score is tied and the winner is undecided
= synonyms: draw
- a social or business relationship
= synonyms: association
- equality of score in a contest
verb
- form a knot or bow in
= example: form a knot or bow in
- limit or restrict to
= example: limit or restrict to
- finish a game with an equal number of points, goals, etc.
= example: finish a game with an equal number of points, goals, etc.
= synonyms: draw
- fasten or secure with a rope, string, or cord
= example: fasten or secure with a rope, string, or cord
= synonyms: bind
- connect, fasten, or put together two or more pieces
= synonyms: link
- unite musical notes by a tie
- make by tying pieces together
= example: make by tying pieces together
- perform a marriage ceremony
= synonyms: wed
- create social or emotional ties
= synonyms: bond
